intro: Thibaudia gunnarii, commonly known as the New Zealand thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. Thibaudia gunnarii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
